intro: Chimonanthus yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan winter jasmine, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its bright yellow, fragrant flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often used in traditional Chinese medicine. The shrub thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
